item.name: 20th Century
item.comment: Can be a bit slow with 5 players. It can be hard to compensate a bad scoring in round 2 or 4.

item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
item.wishlistcomment: Fun game to play with my two boys (8 and 10)

item.name: Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game
Age of Steam Expansion: Paris & Moscow
Age of Steam Expansion: The Zombie Apocalypse
Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small – Even More Buildings Big and Small
American Rails
item.wishlistcomment: Like Chicago express and this should be even better. Already one copy in our group, so not top priority.

item.name: Angry Birds: Knock on Wood
item.comment: this is a toy, not a game. hitting the pigs is nearly impossible. broken.

item.name: At the Gates of Loyang
item.comment: Good game. Best with two. Three or four takes too long to play. Rating is two player game is 8, 3 or 4 is 7.

item.name: Axis & Allies: Spring 1942, The World Is at War!
Bausack
item.wishlistcomment: and again fun game to play with my two boys (8 and 10). I think even my wife would love this one!

item.name: Black Friday
item.comment: Nice game about THE stockmarket. A new theme for me!

item.name: Bokken Schieten
item.comment: bokken schieten

item.name: Bone Wars: The Game of Ruthless Paleontology
Bootleggers
item.comment: Has nice elements (trading, negotiations, backstabbing), but it just takes too long for what it is. Luck is an important factor and someone can really lag behind en be in a hopeless position to win, with still some playing time on the clock. Could work with the right group and a restriction on the number of rounds.

item.name: A Brief History of the World
Brugge
item.wishlistcomment: A lot of good buzz, but haven't tried it. No-one in our gaming group has it, so that's a reason to have it :).

item.name: The Builders: Middle Ages
item.wishlistcomment: nice little WP cardgame with a race element: the game ends when someone collect 17 VP.

item.name: Carcassonne Junior
item.comment: very good kids game. Nice intro to carcasonne

item.name: Carcassonne: De Draak, De Fee, De Jonkvrouw
Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
Dominant Species
item.wishlistcomment: Very curious about this one. It's pretty heavy in weight and length, but I love the theme!

item.name: Doom: The Boardgame
item.comment: Takes just too long to pay

item.name: Dragon Run
item.comment: great artwork. incan gold style game, but with a bit more choices and some player interaction.

item.name: Dragonscroll
item.comment: Too much luck driven: luck of the draw, but most of all the fire ball tower. This broke the game for us.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
A Fake Artist Goes to New York
Five Points: Gangs of New York
Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Dangerous Waters
Fleet
item.wishlistcomment: Has a dominion feeling, which I like. Played twice and love it. Only I already know two gamebuddies who own it.

item.name: Formula Dé
item.comment: A race takes too long for a higher grade

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: just a lot of fun

item.name: The Game: Spiel...so lange du kannst!
Gepakt & Gezakt
item.comment: Nice filler for six for THE whole family.

item.name: GUBS: A Game of Wit and Luck
Le Havre: The Inland Port
item.comment: boring! Just pushing some cubes around and collecting some small fiddle chits. I love le Havre. It's one of my favourite games, but this is a big mistake by Uwe Rosenberg. 2 pers. short game Le Havre takes 45 min. and is very enjoyable and this isn't adding anything new to that.

item.name: De Hobbit
item.originalname: The Hobbit: The Defeat of Smaug

item.name: Horse Fever
item.comment: This is somewhere between a party game and a gamers game. Doesn't do eihter perfect.

item.name: Imperial Settlers: Why Can't We Be Friends
In de Ban van de Ring
In de Ban van de Ring: Familiespel
In de Ban van de Ring: Het Duel
item.originalname: Lord of the Rings: The Duel

item.name: In Love and War
item.comment: basically rummy with a small twist and a childrens theme of fluffy kittens who want to get married. Not my game.

item.name: Ingenious
item.comment: Genius

item.name: Kaas Kasteel
item.comment: kaaskasteel

item.name: Kardinaal & Koning
item.comment: kardinaal & koning

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment: Lots of fun as a filler on a gaming night or as a quick game with the kids.

item.name: King of Tokyo: Power Up!
item.wishlistcomment: King of tokyo is a good filler. The kids like it. This gives some extra's. Played it twice, but not fully convinced.

item.name: Koehandel
item.comment: Koehandel

item.name: De Kolonisten van Catan: Het Kaartspel
De Kolonisten van de Prehistorie
item.originalname: The Settlers of the Stone Age

item.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
De Legenden van Andor
item.wishlistcomment: I prefer the Dutch edition. English is OK, but not so handy with the kids.

item.name: De Legenden van Andor: Het Sterrenschild
item.originalname: Legends of Andor: The Star Shield

item.name: Lewis & Clark
item.wishlistcomment: Like the looks and the racing element. One copy in the group. Not played it yet. Promising.

item.name: Lord of the Rings Trivia Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring Chess Set
Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
Machiavelli
item.comment: Machiavelli

item.name: Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India
Masters of Trade
item.comment: Played Rotterdam with and without this extension. Best with extension.

item.name: Memoir '44: Overlord
item.comment: Gives a new dimension to memoir!

item.name: Merkator
item.comment: Game That has to grow on you. Second Play feels better. Rate slowly rises.

item.name: Mice and Mystics
item.wishlistcomment: Should be good fun with the kids

item.name: Middle-Earth
item.comment: Never understood this game completely. For years it has only been a part of my Tolkien collection.

item.name: Monopoly Junior
item.comment: only for young kids

item.name: New York Kings
item.comment: not my kind of game. This can shine with the right group of people. Don't take it to serious. Screw each others plans. Theme works good with the gameplay

item.name: OddVille
item.comment: played it at Essen 2012. OK cardgame but nothing special. Offers not much new theme or mechanics.

item.name: Ora et Labora
item.comment: Pretty heavy game with a lot of options. This gets better after a few plays.

item.name: Packhuys
item.comment: packhuys

item.name: The Palaces of Carrara
item.comment: Game with nice mechanics, but the theme is rather thin. Would like to play it again in the future, but would not buy it.

item.name: Pinguin Panic
item.comment: Pinguin paniek

item.name: Port Royal: Ein Auftrag geht noch...
Race for the Galaxy
item.comment: Has a learning curve. First play you've got no clue what you're doing. Now I'm beginning to understand it! Only downside is the limited interaction.

item.name: Raj
item.comment: hol's der geier

item.name: Regenwormen
item.comment: regenwormen

item.name: Risk: The Lord of the Rings Trilogy Edition
item.comment: extra point for the LOTR theme

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
item.wishlistcomment: Theme works well with the gameplay. played once the basic scenario, which went easy.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
The Scepter of Zavandor
item.comment: Not advisable with 5 players or more. It just takes too long.

item.name: Shave a Sheep
item.comment: Nice game for kids. They liked it. Has two difficulty levels.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
item.comment: I like this game a Lot. After four plays it still intrigues me. It has a pretty high learning curve, so you need a game or two to get the hang of it. From that moment it gets only better. You get a good overview of the game and can focus on how you are going to win the game. Not so good with two players: when one is winning the game the other can't do much about it.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game – Fame and Fortune
item.comment: makes a good game even better: more balance between the winning conditions

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game – Wisdom and Warfare
Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
Snowdonia
item.comment: Every game is different with the ever changing weather and the chances of drawing the white cubes, which triggers actions from the game itself. You have to adapt every game to the circumstances.

item.name: Star Realms
item.comment: Feels too familiar with dominion and ascension, so I don't care much for it.

item.name: Stef Stuntpiloot
item.comment: Best kids game ever!

item.name: Stone Age: Mit Stil zum Ziel
Suburbia: Essen SPIEL Expansion
item.comment: these extra tiles are stronger than average. If you allow someone to build all three of them, you probably give the game away.

item.name: Terra Mystica
item.wishlistcomment: like rosenberg, like scepter of Zavandor (last game of the designer) and read only good reviews. Only things against it is playing time.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Thurn and Taxis: Power and Glory
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 1 – Team Asia & Legendary Asia
Tokaido
item.comment: Easy to learn, looks great! Plays quickly but has variety and some strategic options. Should appeal to children, families and gamers (more as a filler/starter for the last group).

item.name: Totemo
item.comment: Nice little game. Good filler and family game with a refreshing design (board is made of cloth!).

item.name: Tzolk'in: De Kalender van de Maya's
Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar – Mini Expansion 1
The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow: Characters
Wie is het?
item.comment: wie is het?

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.wishlistcomment: Nice party game, but not available in Holland.

item.name: Zeeslag
item.comment: zeeslag
